Participants.evidence: 10 patients with TPFs were treated at our hospital

Intervention.evidence: compare the biomechanical strength and directional deformation between standard medial dual plates (MDPs) and medial customized plate (MCP).

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to validate the feasibility of customized implants through optimized manufacturing within a clinically acceptable timeframe and evaluate the mechanical strength of customized internal implants through finite element analysis.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From May 1, 2023, to June 1, 2023, 10 patients with TPFs were treated

Number_Analysed.evidence: Follow-up analysis showed operative times of 1.37 ± 0.58 h, intraoperative blood loss of 260 ± 179.20 mL, and favorable functional outcomes

Result_Outcome.evidence: the γ‐type plate showed comparable strength to the MDPs system via finite element analysis and demonstrated a more vital ability to resist the separation of fracture fragments, with the maximum displacement of MDPs (0.61878 mm) 2.4 times higher than that of MCP (0.26124 mm).
